meanings.definition: Jobes (noun): plural form of job, a paid position of regular employment
meanings.sent1: She has three jobes at different companies.
meanings.sent2: Finding jobes can be challenging in today's economy.
meanings.sent3: The jobes were all lined up neatly on her resume.
meanings.sent4: His jobes were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The word 'jobes' always reminds me of hard work and dedication.

meanings.definition: Jobes (verb): third person singular present of job, to work by the piece or at odd jobs
meanings.sent1: He jobes at the construction site every day.
meanings.sent2: She jobes as a freelancer to have a flexible schedule.
meanings.sent3: The cat jobes around the house, pretending to be busy.
meanings.sent4: The sun jobes behind the clouds, playing peek-a-boo.
meanings.sent5: The river jobes smoothly, never rushing its flow.
